text: HubSpot is doing something funky with our URL encoding -- I'm using `{{project.project_slug|replace("&", "&")}}`  to get back the &. As of yesterday, the & is now %26amp. Does anyone know how I can add a second replace in the code above to essentially catch both? Thanks!
I'm not sure if it needs a double `|` or not
I'm only famliar with using 'and' on an if statement etc
Hmmm not sure why but it does not work; I also reverted and now it has broken. The & is not being replaced from just one now. Weird..
I was able to get this working actually but setting the project_slug as a variable first
I know it sounds dumb but apparently that's what it needed

Other question. Is there a way to interact with these attributes in hubl or it is just with the embed code?

_onFormReady_
_onFormSubmit_
_onBeforeFormSubmit_
_onFormSubmitted_

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options#:~:text=onFormSubmit,onFormSubmitted(%24form%2C%20data)>

Hey Louis, I think I understand what you're asking. Unfortunately, HubSpot redirect to thank you page is faster than the forms API (used to pass data to the record). So, you run into a racing issue where you want some value displayed on the thank you page but it hasn't been written to the record and available to use on the thank you page yet. You'll have to use some other method to pass a value to the thank you page. Example, you can create a custom form (not w/in HubSpot), form submits to forms API, then the redirect to thank you has the input value passed as a URL parameter.

Hope that helps.
hi can u use hubl on module.css?
